discussion.content:
Configuration steps:
1. Create a single PSTN usage.
2. Configure three voice routes.
3. Create a voice routing policy.
4. Assign the policy to a user.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to configure voice routing for Direct Routing. The solution must only allow calling within the United States and Canada for a user named user1@contoso.com.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence to minimize user call disruption? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

NOTE: More than one order of answer choices is correct. You will receive credit for any of the correct orders you select.

//IMG//

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams Phone.

You have 10 SIP devices that were used in a previous phone system.

You verify compatibility with Teams Phone.

You need to ensure that users can call from SIP devices in Teams.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer B is correct. 
you need to go to TAC-->Voice->Calling Policies-->Manage policies-->select and edit a policy -->SIP devies can be used for calls --->Turn On-->Save

Selected Answer: B
B is correct - not C

Selected Answer: B
I think it's answer B. The use of SIP devices is deactivated by default and must first be activated in the calling policies. Otherwise you cannot register the devices and make calls.

comments.content: but they were used in another phone system so the license is not assigned

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think C because all other make no sense... Users have E5 and phone licence are assigned to user and not to phone

choices.A: Assign a Teams Phone Standard add-on license to each SIP device.
choices.D: Assign a Microsoft Teams Shared Devices license to each SIP device.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The question mentions AD DS domain, which makes me lean towards Group Policy. The cmdlet for modifying devices should be Set-CsTeamsRoom -Identity $device -DirectGuestJoinEnabled $true, which isn't mentioned. The cmdlet mentioned would be for a policy change.

Selected Answer: C
To enable Direct Guest Join on all 50 Teams Rooms devices with minimal administrative effort, you should deploy a SkypeSettings.xml file to each device by using Group Policy (Option C). This method allows you to configure multiple devices efficiently and ensure they are set up correctly for Direct Guest Join

I will go for D.

You
then why not answer C?
Copilot
While using the SkypeSettings.xml file (option C) can be a valid method for configuring certain settings on Teams Rooms devices, it involves more manual steps and potentially greater administrative effort compared to the other options.

Running the Set-CsTeamsGuestMeetingConfiguration cmdlet (option D) can be more efficient, as it centralizes the configuration changes and applies them across multiple devices with less manual intervention.

However, if you prefer using Group Policy for consistency or have existing processes around it, then deploying the SkypeSettings.xml file would also be a viable approach. Both methods are correct, but the cmdlet might save you time and effort in large deployments.

choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Guest access settings.
choices.C: Deploy a SkypeSettings.xml file to each device by using Group Policy.

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an on-premises Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) domain named contoso.com.

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You plan to implement Microsoft Teams Rooms shared room video conferencing.

You deploy 50 Teams Rooms on Windows devices and join each device to contoso.com.

You need to enable Direct Guest Join on all 50 devices. The solution must minimize administrative effort.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
To ensure that User1 can host a live event, you should set the following two settings to On:

Broadcast production with NDI and SDI hardware (Option D) - This setting is essential for live event production, allowing integration with professional broadcasting equipment.
Video Conferencing (Option E) - This setting ensures that video conferencing capabilities are enabled, which is crucial for hosting live events

D. Broadcast production with NDI and SDI hardware: This setting allows the user to use external production tools and hardware for broadcasting the live event, which is crucial for hosting professional live events.

E. Video Conferencing: This setting enables the ability to have video conferencing capabilities during the live event, ensuring that video feeds can be shared.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams deployment.

A user named User1 plans to host a live event.

You create a new meeting policy and set Screen sharing mode to Entire screen.

You need to complete the meeting policy configuration to ensure that User1 can host the live event.

Which two settings should you set to On? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Broadcast production with NDI and SDI hardware

discussion.content: Seems correct. First number will match NewSouthWales-Local (start with 7 followed by 7 numbers, the rule will add +612. Second number will not match first rule (7 not in the [2-9] range), will not match second rule (9 not in [38]), will match third rule (19 followed by numbers) as the question states "numbers that BEGIN with 1900".
